results.title: Landscape
results.creator_credit: Peter Riding and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Exploring Photography”.
Deals with a wide variety of approaches to landscape photography, including the adventurous work of Ernst Haas and the more symbolic black and white of John Blakemore. Presented by Bryn Campbell.

results.title: Landline: Stripping the Myth
results.brief_description:
‘Landline’ is the ABC’s national rural issues program.

This episode investigates the conventionally accepted history of the invention and development of the combine harvester. The widely held belief that a young Victorian, Hugo Victor McKay, was the inventor of the world’s first such machine is exposed as a myth.

First broadcast on 13th March, 2005.

holdings.name: MOV file H264; ACMI Digital Access Copy - presentation

results.title: Landfill
results.brief_description: This film tells of an operation in the United States to dispose of solid waste with a minimum of danger to the environment and people. Refuse is transported to a site away from the cities where several large steep gullies have been excavated for the purpose of holding the waste material. When filled with refuse, the gullies are covered avoiding infestation by flies, rats and seagulls.

results.title: Landfall Asia
results.creator_credit: Gordon Sparling, William Canning, Tim Wilson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A spring cruise to the Far East with three destroyers of the Royal Canadian Navy. The film follows the ships to the exotic ports of Japan, Hong Kong, Ceylon, Bangkok. Highlighted is the Commonwealth exercise, “Jetex,” a simulated naval engagement.

results.title: Land without music
results.creator_credit: Walter Forde, Max Schach, Capitol Film Corporation and J H Productions
results.brief_description: A light-hearted operetta composed by Oscar Straus and adapted for the screen by Rudolf Bernauer based on a supposedly true story that took place in the early part of the 19th century. It is a tale of forbidden music where no instruments or singing is allowed in order that the townsfolk can concentrate on more serious things such as making money to pay off the town’s debts. Stars Richard Tauber as Mario Carlini and features Jimmy Durante (Schnozzle) as Jonah J. Whistler. Cast also includes Diana Napier (Princess Regent), June Clyde (Sadie Whistler), Derrick de Marney (Rudolpho Strozzi, Esme Percy (Austrian Ambassador).

results.title: Land without bread = Las Hurdes
results.brief_description: An uncompromising study of a remote village in northwest Spain isolated from the surrounding world until the construction of a road in 1922. Records the community’s poverty, disease and despair over a two month period. Observes the role played by the church and education system in promoting oppression. Bunuel sought to push his audience beyond pity. An academic narration over Brahm’s majestic Fourth Symphony is designed to disconcert or anger the viewer. Writen by Luis Bunuel and Pierre Unik. Cinematography by Elie Lotar.

results.title: Land Without Bread
results.brief_description: A surrealistic documentary portrait of the region of Las Hurdes, a remote region of Spain where civilisation has barely developed, showing how the local peasants try to survive without even the most basic utilities and skills.

constellations_other.name: Reconstructing reality
constellations_other.description: While documentary pertains to be about the truth, many filmmakers and artists have used ingenious reconstructions to represent an abstracted honesty.

results.description: An exploration — manipulated and staged— of life in Las Hurdes, in the province of Cáceres, in Extremadura, Spain, as it was in 1932. Misery and lack of opportunities are portrayed through a surrealistic documentary of a region that has been largely untouched by civilisation.
description_for_label: An exploration — manipulated and staged— of life in Las Hurdes, in the province of Cáceres, in Extremadura, Spain, as it was in 1932. Misery and lack of opportunities are portrayed through a surrealistic documentary of a region that has been largely untouched by civilisation.

results.title: Land use and misuse
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Davidson Films
results.brief_description: Describes malpractice in the use of land surfaces. Shows how deforestation, erosion by wind and water, industrial and agricultural abuses and urban development can create loss of water, crops and wildlife and can even cause climatic changes. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
